Necromancer Tower
Released28 May 2002 (Update)
MembersYes

Map
Advanced data
Typebuilding

The Necromancer Tower is a tower south of East Ardougne where a few necromancers reside.

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 Ground floor
  • 3 First floor
  • 4 NPCs
  • 5 Monsters
  • 6 Trivia

Location[edit | edit source]

The Necromancer Tower is south of East Ardougne and north-east of the Tower of Life. Besides walking, the tower can be easily reached by two teleport methods:

  • Ardougne Teleport brings the player to the East Ardougne marketplace, with the tower to the south.
  • Fairy ring code djp brings the player right next to the tower. Use of fairy rings requires partial completion of the quest A Fairy Tale Part II.

The closest bank without using teleportation is the one south of the marketplace in East Ardougne. The map shows the shortest route between the bank and the Tower of Life, and the same route can be used for the Necromancer Tower (note that players do not have to go through the Ardougne Zoo using this route). If players can use fairy rings, then the bank in Zanaris is closer.

Ground floor[edit | edit source]

The ground floor of the tower.

Players can speak with Irwin Feaselbaum, who talks about the disruptions that occur all the time when adventurers confront his boss, Invrigar the Necromancer. Players cannot fight Irwin.

A Necromancer also inhabits this floor. If the player fights the necromancer, he will occasionally call up Summoned Zombies that also attack the player. The necromancer will occasionally drop Zamorak robes.

If players search a bookcase on this floor, they will discover that a book is 'On loan to the Wizards' Guild...to be returned.' This is probably a reference to the Necromancy book in the possession of Sithik Ints at the Wizards' Guild.

First floor[edit | edit source]

The upper floor of the tower.

Invrigar the Necromancer lives on this floor. If you fight him, he will occasionally call up Summoned Zombies that also attack you.

NPCs[edit | edit source]

  • Irwin Feaselbaum

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Summoned Zombie (level 13)
  • Invrigar the Necromancer (level 20)
  • Necromancer (level 26)

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Necromancer Tower is one of only a few sources of Zamorak monk robes, and the only one near a bank. The robes are a rare drop from the Necromancer, but he only drops one item (top or bottom) at a time and has a very long respawn time, making attempts to acquire the robes in this manner quite tedious. They can be more easily obtained as a common drop from Monks of Zamorak found throughout RuneScape, and the Disciples of Iban where both pieces are a 100% drop (although they are found deep inside the Underground Pass dungeon).
  • One bookcase on the ground floor is out of reach behind the staircase and cannot be searched, despite the option for searching it being present.
  • Despite being a prominent feature on the map, the Necromancer Tower serves no significant purpose.

The '''Necromancer Tower''' is a tower south of [[East Ardougne]] where a few [[Necromancer (disambiguation)|necromancer]]s reside.

==Location==
The Necromancer Tower is south of East Ardougne and north-east of the [[Tower of Life]]. Besides walking, the tower can be easily reached by two teleport methods:
*[[Ardougne Teleport]] brings the player to the East Ardougne marketplace, with the tower to the south.
*[[Fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|djp}} brings the player right next to the tower. Use of fairy rings requires partial completion of the quest [[A Fairy Tale Part II]].

The closest bank without using teleportation is the one south of the marketplace in East Ardougne. The map shows the shortest route between the bank and the Tower of Life, and the same route can be used for the Necromancer Tower (note that players do not have to go through the Ardougne Zoo using this route). If players can use fairy rings, then the bank in Zanaris is closer.

==Ground floor==
[[File:Necromancer Tower inside.png|thumb|left|250px|The ground floor of the tower.]]
Players can speak with [[Irwin Feaselbaum]], who talks about the disruptions that occur all the time when adventurers confront his boss, [[Invrigar the Necromancer]]. Players cannot fight Irwin.

A [[Necromancer (Necromancer Tower)|Necromancer]] also inhabits this floor. If the player fights the necromancer, he will occasionally call up [[Summoned Zombie]]s that also attack the player. The necromancer will occasionally drop [[Zamorak robe]]s.

If players search a bookcase on this floor, they will discover that a book is 'On loan to the Wizards' Guild...to be returned.' This is probably a reference to the [[Necromancy book]] in the possession of [[Sithik Ints]] at the [[Wizards' Guild]].

==First floor==
[[File:Necromancer Tower upstairs.png|thumb|250px|The upper floor of the tower.]]
Invrigar the Necromancer lives on this floor. If you fight him, he will occasionally call up [[Summoned Zombie]]s that also attack you.

==NPCs==
*[[Irwin Feaselbaum]]

==Monsters==
*[[Summoned Zombie]] (level 13)
*[[Invrigar the Necromancer]] (level 20)
*[[Necromancer (Necromancer Tower)|Necromancer]] (level 26)

==Trivia==
*The Necromancer Tower is one of only a few sources of [[Zamorak monk robes]], and the only one near a bank. The robes are a rare drop from the Necromancer, but he only drops one item (top or bottom) at a time and has a very long respawn time, making attempts to acquire the robes in this manner quite tedious. They can be more easily obtained as a common drop from [[Monk of Zamorak|Monks of Zamorak]] found throughout RuneScape, and the [[Disciple of Iban|Disciples of Iban]] where both pieces are a 100% drop (although they are found deep inside the [[Underground Pass (dungeon)|Underground Pass dungeon]]).
*One bookcase on the ground floor is out of reach behind the staircase and cannot be searched, despite the option for searching it being present.
*Despite being a prominent feature on the map, the Necromancer Tower serves no significant purpose.
